Reviews.Title: “Very well located, good breakfast and room for the price!”
Reviews.Author: gatastrasse
Reviews.Content: The only thing I did not like were the matresses as they were really soft/flabby (?), the opposite of firm/hard. The view to the canal is spectacular, but even if I do not mind, the hotel is noisy due to the boats (motors), gondolas and turists. I would stay here again (budget place-75 â‚¬ in cash, Carnival period).

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For!”
Reviews.Author: KIWICAROL53
Reviews.Content: Me and my daughter (ages 50+ and 20) stayed at this Hotel and loved it! Lets face it - you are in VENICE! and if you are after budget accommodation thats what you get! So dont complain. It is very basic - sure it needs alot of TLC but I dont like paying extra for 'lovely furniture'. As long as the place is clean and tidy (which this place is) then thats fine with me. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Our room was very basic - bed,wardrobe,handbasin,table and window overlooking one of the canals(which is entertaining watching all the activity). Breakfast was great. The position of hotel is perfect for getting out and about exploring Venice. As far as I am concerned, its the perfect place to put your head down at night after a long day of exploring the most beautiful city in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venice hotel on budget”
Reviews.Author: Matt P
Reviews.Content: Our room had a balcony overlooking a small canal. Perfect. Its a small budget hotel in Venice, dont expect the ritzcarlton. But for the price I dont think it can be beat. I dont know what problems people had with the owner, I thought he was very efficient and nice enough in taking care of us. Breakfast was nice: cereal, bagels, croissants, various deli meats, jams, juice and coffees. Very central location to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever with a hotel owner!”
Reviews.Author: Niagaragirl100
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel and received a confirmation from the owner Cagnato Massimo in March 25/11. When we arrived in mid- July, he told us he gave our room away. He was very nasty and rude and blamed us for the problem. He said he sent us another e-mail in July asking for additional credit card information or he would cancel our reservation. We had previously confirmed in writing that we would pay in cash. We told him that we left for Europe July 1 and do not check our e-mail while we are on holidays. Massimo argued that people are supposed to check their e-mail every day, even when on vacation. He said we would not find another room anywhere in Venice as the fireworks festival was on that week. We eventually managed to find an apartment to rent at twice the price of this hotel after many enquiries.Thanks to Massimo's treatment, we have very bad memories of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend it to anybody”
Reviews.Author: Juan L
Reviews.Content: The owner, Massimo, is sneaky and a rude person. We didn't feel comfortable at all. They also put a hold on our credit card for a month. Place is well located but they only care for the money not the clients. If you still decide to go just be prevented.

Reviews.Title: “Not even if you paid me”
Reviews.Author: ClaireA79
Reviews.Content: This place is a dive spend the extra money and get somewhere or anywhere else. They put a hold on your credit card that stay on up to a month. There rude and the rooms are dirty and full of bugs. My bed was on a angle.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back tomorrow!”
Reviews.Author: shelley w
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel for the money. Unique, querky, slightly old-fashioned, and utterly in keeping with the whole "decaying renaissance grandeur" that is Venice! Despite being at the height of the season, it was peaceful. Our room over-looked the quiet little canal which - to our surprise - was on the "gondola route" so we had fun and a birds-eye view, watching the occaional passing gondola: got some goods photos, and one boat had an opera singer on board - when he finished his song he was surprised when we applauded from our window! It is tricky to find - and had it not been for another review we read, we would have had problems. The best route it to go to Rialto, get directions for the Disney Store (only about 3 mins walk) and then take the alley way down the right hand side of the store, over the bridge into the campo Maria fava (you see the big church infront of you). Take the alley to the righthand side of the church (there is a sign for the hotel cavena on the wall), turn right and its under the little archway. The staff are friendly and helpful: desk is open 24/7, but not all of the staff speak english, but most are fine. We read a review about the breakast not being up to much so we went elsewhere the first two days. This was a mistake! On the 3rd day (due to tiredness) we decided to try it - it was great and the best deal for the money that we found. No fry up (but then you dont expect that on the continent) however there was ham and pinapple, fruit juice, tea, coffee,choice of cereals, bread rolls, coissants (the Italian sort with apricot jam inside), cheese etc as much as you wanted. The rooms are quite basic - but very clean and with everything you need - hairdryer, fan, hanging space, tv, reading lamp. Only thing you could want would be tea/coffee making facilities. The bathroom was shared, but we were surprised tht this wasnt a problem and everything is spotlessly clean. The only slight downside was that, this is a "working canal" and around 7am the "bin men" come round in their boat collecting the rubbish which can be a bit noisy - but actually the fact that the canal was used by the community did make it feel as though we were staying in "real venice" ! The staff were very helpful and despite us vacating the room around 9am on our last day, were happy to look after our cases until 7pm when we needed to leave for our flight. We had a great time. It's a good location once you find it, easy to walk to everything and access the vaporettos. Sweet and atmospheric - and great value for money. When I return to venice I will definately be booking the Hotel Cavena again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug_SAR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the Rialto bridge and San Marco. A fantastic location! The staffs were friendly and there was free WiFi which was a great, my only reservation is that the hotel wad quite dated, and very basic. Having said that it was clean and tidy and an easy place to rest after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “This is the most terrible hotel experience I ever have”
Reviews.Author: Simpleyy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited venice on June 22. We chose this hotel partly becos we booked too late and now is peak season for Venice. The hotel caneva is only the few still available. Things start getting weird the moment we stepped in. 1,They asked for full payment while other hotels only do it the day u leave. 2, they charge 20euros extra for our credit card payment without any notice! 3, their room is so rusty. Floor peeling everywhere. Not even a single decoration in the room. 4,we overheard another guest, been waken up and requested to change to another room at MIDNIGHT. There is also bedbugs in the bed! 5,the owner and his staff are so rude rude. They are not willing to solve any single complain. They are like gangsters. 6, the hotel is along the canal. We thought, wow, river view.... But.... In fact, there is no fantastic view at all. Instead, at night, there is plenty of noise from the gondolas till 12 midnight. In the morning, there are garbage collection boats, noisy enough to wake u up fom 6am. Terrible! In conclusion, don't risk yourself to stay in this hotel!!! For gods sake.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great location but terrible administration”
Reviews.Author: Divinora
Reviews.Content: It was the worst experience ever... We had to live there for 6 nights but spent there less than 15 minutes. The reason for this short staying was the fact that our booking was cancelled without our knowing. So just imagine: we came to Venice and found out we had no place to live, although we booked this hotel a few month before! And they didn't send us any letter or phone call... The man at the reception desk didn't seem any care about us, told it wasn't his problem, refused to help and advised us to look for a new hotel to stay. He was very rude and impolite, when we asked for help he just screamed at us. I think this hotel extremely needs new management, because the location is just great but people there are awful. Fortunately we found good people in another hotel near(Hotel Canaletto) and they helped us to solve our problem.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location ... Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Suzie22
Reviews.Content: The handy location of this hotel makes it easy to get around and see the sights of Venice and there are lots of interesting shops, bars & restaurants close by. It is a budget hotel so dont expect it to be luxurious. Our room was very clean, a great size and overlooked the canal. Staff were pleasant and very helpful and breakfast was simple but adequate. My only complaint is the early morning noise of the workers on the canal which made it difficult to sleep in ... but this is just part of life in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: kam512
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how this hotel has so many high ratings. Our experience was so awful I feel the need to write this as I'm still sitting inside the room. Even for a budget hotel, this was terrible. To start, the inside is dirty and run down. Our small room had a hole in the wall, mold in the bathroom (which is really just a shower since the water fills the entire space), and faces a loud canal. What really bugged us the most was when we noticed the sheets were stained. When we got back, we realized they had just re-made the bed with the same stained sheets and we also didn't see any new towels (which are hard as rocks, by the way). Since the lady working at the front desk didn't speak English, we tried to translate and explain that the sheets were dirty and ask if we could get new ones, as well as towels. She told us that since we were only staying 2 nights, we couldn't get new sheets. After trying our best to explain the stain was old and not from us, she stormed off, grabbed a sheet and 2 towels, threw it in our room and slammed the door on us only after cussing the whole way in Italian. Later on we realized that they had actually given us towels after all and just put them in a different spot. We left for dinner and after returning noticed a set of the towels were gone. We asked the owner at the front desk if someone came into our room and he said yes, he could come into our room anytime because he's the owner and called us liars about the towels. He also mentioned that if we want clean sheets we could stay in a 4 star hotel. STAY AWAY! This is below low budget and we're not even sure if we feel safe staying here tonight or if any of our items are missing, since they have no qualms about entering your room after you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely staff - great location”
Reviews.Author: GladstoneGirl
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful, particularly Stephano and Massimo, who were more than happy to help with any requests. In particular, they were very helpful in accommodating a change in our dates due to unavailablity of trains from Paris. They kindly found a way to accomodate our new dates. The location was excellent and within quick walking distance to both the Rialto Bridge and San Marco. It was also helpful that we were able to leave our luggage with them until late in the afternoon. The facilities are in need of some general repair. My sheets had a rip in them, and the towels were very hard. It also would have been great to have some extra pillows. Also, the shower was a hand held one, with no screen which meant that water ended up all over the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Owner is unhelpful with insturctions and has an attitude in helping us find this difficult to locate hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdhy8ftsa7eyr
Reviews.Content: For students traveling on a budget one would think this is a good bargain but you get little for your money. The owner refused to give instructions on how to get to his hotel claiming that it was my responsibility to look on his map which I did and it told me nothing. I looked on the Google map as well and instructions were confusing. I explained this to him and he told me to call Google for them to correct it. Then when I finally got the info on what vaporetto to take from the train station I asked for walking instructions and he told me to call him again and hung up. This was the beginning of everything else that followed

Reviews.Title: “A backstreet treasure !”
Reviews.Author: ROOSTER1984
Reviews.Content: This little hotel/guesthouse is a little hidden gem right in the heart of venice.It is only a few minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge so is right near all the action.The bedromms are very basic but for the price what do you expect.The cleanliness of the hotel is superb, rooms cleaned daily, beds & towels changed daily.Corridors and bathrooms were sparkling ! Location wise this is the best place to stay excedllent value for money. Now for the downsides......... Very hard to find the hotel at first as Venice is full of hundreds of small alleyways and you would be suprised by how many people dont speak english.Tip ...... If you need to ask for directions find a gondalez man, there's plenty of them and they all speak english.If arriving at Marco Polo airport go to the lalilaguna ticket booth and ask for a boat ticket to rialto.The laliliaguna boats are by fare the cheapest way to travel.Water taxis are an absolute rip off.We wanted to go 5 minutes down the road one night and got quoted â‚¬50.When you get off the lalilaguna boat at the rialto find a gondalez man,there are loads of them and ask for directions to the Disney Store.Once you get to the Disney Store there is a small alley way at the side of it.Go down this alleyway and at the end there is a small bridge.Go over it,then keep to the left which will take you down another small alleyway.You should then see a sign on the wall saying "To Caneva Hotel" follow the arrow on the sign.Then hey presto your'e there.We always used the disney store as a landmark for finding our way back. Also the breakfast is continental, there is no toast just cereal,croissants and biscuits.So if you are looking for a fry up, yoou will be dissappointed ! Last thing to mention is that the rooms arent ensuite so you have to use the toilet & showers oout on the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Value in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tracyw13
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to save money but stay in a great location in Venice. We stayed for 5 days and our room was bright, clean and spacious. Clean towels were provided and our room was directly next to the bathroom, which was kept so clean that you would never know it was shared. Do not be concerned about sharing a bathroom as we had no problems with accessibility. The location can't be beat (easy to find when following the hotels directions), 5 minutes from San Marco square, 2 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The first time finding it was a little tricky but it is in a quiet area right on one of the side canals and all other areas are easily reached by foot. If you are not too fussy - this is the perfect place to stay when in Venice - if we ever go back we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Clean. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: fylgja
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights last July. The hotel is quite near to the main attractions but is located at a quiet street near Rialto (a 2 min. walk from Rialto). It's an old building - there are some little cracks on the ceiling and the walls need to be painted - but everything is very clean. Our room was cleaned and the towels and linen were changed every day. We were given a given a room with views to the canal. The breakfast was rather basic but nice and the staff was very friendly. Strongly recommended if you are looking for a quiet place and don't want to spend too much.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find in Venice!!!”
Reviews.Author: ScottinLA50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my cousin for 4 nights in October 2010. This is a cute little hotel right on one of the side canals. Location can't be beat, 5 minutes from San Marco square, 2 minutes from the Rialto Bridge. The first time finding it was a little tricky but it is in a quiet area right on one of the side canals. This hotel was better than some of the 2 or 3 star places I have stayed at in Europe. We had a shared room on the 2nd floor with twins beds. The room was small but had a sink. The shared bathrooms were super clean. Our room also had a view and a small balcony of the canals. Breakfast was simple but got the job done, mostly cereals, croissants, coffee, and tea. Food is expensive in Venice so that helped. Staff was very kind and friendly to us. Saved money because we paid cash. We paid 70 euros a night instead of 90. Hopefully I can make it back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: barbara_miglentsis2
Reviews.Content: great location, very clean ,slept well,very close to the rialto bridge and st marks square what more could you ask for.a good place to eat try del moma not far away. hotel staff were friendly

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, good price”
Reviews.Author: Lullaby200
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Venice, we had 3 nights at Hotel Caneva and it was great. We had room 30 which had a tiny little balcony which really made our stay as we could sit outside with a glass of wine and watch the gondoliers go past. The hotel is very close to Rialto Bridge so get the vaporetto from Piazza Roma when you arrive with your luggage - don't try to walk like we did!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, basic accomodation”
Reviews.Author: ReneeAbroad
Reviews.Content: We were only in venice for a couple of nights so we wanted something well priced and right in the main area of venice and this is exactly what we got! The location can not be faulted and the room although very sparse was very clean. The only downfall was the lack of air con- as it was exceptionally hot while we were there. Our room was also lacking alot of natural light so make sure you ask for a nice bright room if this is an issue for you. The reception staff were very accommodating. If you aren't too fussy this is a perfect hotel to experience venice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SimandGreg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Caneva in the apartment (2 bedroom, bathroom, kitchen) which is around the corner from the actual hotel. The apartment while like everything in Venice, was old, but it was very clean and had everything we needed for our family of 5 (including 2 teenage daughters and our teenage son). Location was great, five minutes to both St Marks Square and the Rialto Bridge. It is a bit difficult to find the first time, but that's Venice! Breakfast was included at the actual hotel which consisted of packaged brioche, panini, coffee, preserves, two types of cereal in a self serve style. We highly recommend this place (also stayed there 19 years ago on our last trip to Italy when the current owner's father was running the place).

Reviews.Title: “a 3 minute walk to San Marco Square!”
Reviews.Author: lolavegas
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. Although, finding the hotel the first time was a bit of a struggle ( the alleys tend to be confusing), but once settled, it'll be a breeze. Most importantly, you don't need to haul your luggage up the bridge to get to the hotel! The rooms overlook the canal, you can watch the Gondolas make their way through from the window in your room. Breakfast was great as well. The staff were very friendly and helpful! Great value in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great location”
Reviews.Author: 1LouKY_traveler
Reviews.Content: You can't beat 100 Euro a night in the center of Venice. The room was small and spartan, but it was spotlessly clean. Same for the bathroom. Breakfast was a good spread of cold options. If you are a light sleeper, you should probably request a room on the inside of the building ... our window looked out on a canal, which we loved, but we are heavy sleepers and even we were somewhat disturbed by the canal noise in the morning. it wasn't enough to keep us awake, but would surely be a problem for more restless sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but the hotel is a dump and smells....Sorry, thats the way it is!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravelfamily4
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean, the locations was a good one, after we finally found it. The staff was nice, however the rooms are simply old and smelly. You can find better accomadations for the same price if look around a little. Or spend a little more, we were dissapointed that we didn't. We were in this wonderful city for two nights and had a great time, however never wanted to return to the room. Venice is expensive, no doubt about it. Splurge on a room and you will have a much better experience. we had paint pealing in the room, wallpapper hanging off the wall a foot, two electrical outlets for everything, your head was in the sink if you were on the toilet, no soap, smelled like an old must basement................sorry, I don't want to go on, however you probably get the picture.

Reviews.Title: “decent cheap hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rachelshears85
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on STA travel- only Â£25 each a night. A complete bargain for Venice! The location is perfect- 2 mins walk from Rialto Bridge and 4 mins walk from San Marco Square. The outside and reception look lovely. The rooms are decent enough. They could do with a lick of paint. When we opened the shutters we had a view of the canal- FANTASTIC! Beware of the mosquitos at night- I guess it's cos we were near the canal. I NEVER get bitten but I did in this hotel. Take some mosquite spray and a plug-in. For some reason on week days at about 8am we got woken up by a very load boat thing outside!! I think it was their version of the bin men!! We didn't have an ensuite but the bathroom was down the corridor and decent enough.The shower was like a mini cupboard. Breakfast is very basic and I wouldn't bother with it. We weren't looking for luxury so it was fine. I'd definitely stay here again simply because of the price and the location!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find but good value and great service!”
Reviews.Author: JodoKast1221
Reviews.Content: As with any place in Venice this hotel was hard to find even with a map. The entrance is down at the end of what looks like a dark alley but in fact is one of Venice many charming streets. It was great value for the money we paid and the room we stayed in was awesome. It overlooked one of the canals and was probably the biggest hotel room we stayed in during our entire trip through England, France, and Italy. The entire hotel is slowly sinking and is nowhere near level anymore. The ceilings and floors are trued up with wedges and at times it feels like you are trying walk properly in a slanted floor amusement park fun-house but I think that just adds to its charm. For the buildings age it was in surprisingly good shape. The staff were in the process renovating parts of it and expanding the hotel but we never heard any construction noise at all The daily breakfast that was prepared in their dining room was beyond our expectations. Even though our stay in Venice was marred by some of the worst weather I have ever seen and for the most part we were forced to spend too much of our time in our hotel room we still talk fondly of Hotel Caneva, the great breakfast, and watching La Ruota Della Fortuna in our hotel room, waiting for the rain to stop.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Management, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: youngLTtraveler
Reviews.Content: I tried to book the hotel online but their website wasn't working so I emailed the hotel in order to reserve a room and they bumped up their March price to the April price and refused to sell it to me to the genuine price. Then they told me the only room they had left was an apt "in front of the hotel" which was by no means IN FRONT of the hotel. Instead, we had to walk down many allys to find it and the map they gave us didn't even have the street of the apt. on it. Totally unacceptable. The room was FREEZING and when we tried to turn the heat on, the heater started squirting water all over the room. There was no sunlight and the whole place stank of mildew. The owner was SO RUDE and someone who I would never want to deal with ever again. He absolutely refused to admit when he was wrong and instead of being apologetic about sending us through the dark streets of Venice alone at night when we didn't know the city at all, he started to yell at us instead about how we should learn to live like Venetians. Breakfast was acecptable but nothing great. The location is the only great thing about the place which I certainly can't complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad if you're looking for a comfortable budget stay in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: restless-linn
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located on a small street that can easily be missed especially when you arrive in the evening. From the outside, it is a very quaint typical Venetian hotel. When we first arrived, the receptionist was quite rude to us. It wasn't a nice hotel greeting! Lobby: Sometime the receptionist or the inn keeper smokes. Room: Very thin walls. It can get pretty noisy and we heard *everything*. The bed is what you can expect from a budget hotel. Clean. Shared Bathrooms: Make sure you test the hot water first. Some bathrooms are labeled "Shower" but it has no hot water. The bathrooms are clean but very tiny. Breakfast: We stayed there for 3 nights and we had the same breakfast everyday - Bread, jam, butter and cereals. Overall: It's an OK place to stay if you're looking for budget-clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Izzy095
Reviews.Content: Myself and my boyfriend stayed at the hotel for the weekend on arrival we were very pleased to find our hotel right in the middle of everything, two minutes walk from the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. Our room was a good size, very clean and had a beautiful canal view. The staff were very relaxed and friendly and the price was very reasonable, i would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to explore all the sights based in a central and vibrant location

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great value, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Fraborah
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in room 30 which we requested after reading a previous review. We really felt and heard the real Venice. The staff were very friendly. The room was basic but very clean. We found it central to all we had to see in Venice. Would recommend the hotel for travellers on a budget. (Australian)

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: babyfaceHartlepool
Reviews.Content: brilliant location, helpful and cheerful staff, rooms basic but very clean and tidy, breakfast adequate, coffee from a machine but surprisingly very good, cannot fault this hotel for value for money, will definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “A great place for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: BudgetBuddies
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the budget traveller. The staff were good. The hotel was spotless. And the location is handy. However, guests arriving in late at night should note that the walls are thin so be considerate and keep the noise down.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: heberzanolla
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel and I assure you itÂ´s great...It has a good location, close to san Marco and to Rialto...A bit far from the rail station but nothing that a vaporetto(boats used in Venice) wonÂ´t solve...The staff is great too...

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME hotel in a GREAT location! PERFECT for the budget traveller!”
Reviews.Author: superiorcold
Reviews.Content: I can recommend Hotel Caneva to budget travellers enough! It is in the best loaction you can find for Venice. The rooms were clean and tidy. The bedding was clean and towels were provided. The shared facilites were clean and well stocked. The breakfast was very good, with plenty for everyone at the hotel. The lobby staff was friendly and helpful. We had a room that did not have A/C but had 2 fans. We had a window with an excellent view of the private canal below. Overall we had a fantastic stay here in a very magical city. There was an abundance of shops and restuarnts and all of the main sites are withing walking distance from this hotel. HIGHLY RECOMMEND and would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location , old hotel but clean!”
Reviews.Author: SMurphyDublin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situateed 3 min walk from st marks square...the hotel is old and staff not the best but for a budget traveller it is perfect! Breakfast is free and good, the hotel is very clean. It's a little difficult to find but where isnt in Venice!! I would only recomend this hotel to young couples or budget travellers or those who just want a bed to sleep in! Perfect for sightseeing!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cooks5
Reviews.Content: We were two families of 5 (4 adults, 6 kids under 14) and stayed at the Hotel Caneva for 2 nights during our vacation in Italy. Two nights in Venice was just perfect for our group and we were able to see everything we wanted to in that time frame. The Hotel Caneva was one of the more reasonably priced hotels we found in Venice and after doing much research via Trip Advisor as well as other travel sites, we felt confident that it was a good choice. We were not disappointed. While the hotel is not overly fancy, it was very clean and simple with several rooms overlooking a small canal, which was just delightful in the mornings as we opened our shutters to greet the gondoliers and taxi drivers. The office staff was extremely friendly and helpful and the location could not be better for getting around St. Marks or hopping over to the Rialto Bridge area. The pros: * Superb location and great canal views (from certain rooms) * Friendly office staff * Clean rooms * Decent breakfast with juices, pastries and cereals as well as coffee/tea. No hot items though. * Very affordable (for Venice!) and the individual air conditioning units worked beautifully. The cons: * Smoking was permitted in the lobby so it did smell like cigarettes (and as an ex-smoker, this bothered me a little.) * IF you don't like morning activity/noise outside your windows, don't face the canal. We loved it but I could see how it might be bothersome if you are looking to sleep in! Overall, we loved this hotel and the location,despite it being very simple. Would definitely stay there again. They offer a discounted rate if you pay cash (it came out to be about 40 euros, which these days is not insignificant.)

Reviews.Title: “Cheaters and scammers!! Do NOT stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Wanderers
Reviews.Content: The owner was incredibly rude after we looked at the room that we had reserved and found it too dirty to stay in. We tried to be very polite and tell him that the room was just not right for us and told him we would pay for the night anyway. But the room was just too filthy for us to stay there even though we didn't tell him that. We paid full price for the night as we felt that was fair for the inconvienience for him. We then left but not until after the owner yelled and shouted rude obscenities at us. When we returned home we found that he had charged our credit card ( the number of which we had to give him to reserve the room from overseas) for two more nights that we had not stayed!! Stay away from this hotel at all costs!! There are MUCH cheaper, cleaner and more customer friendly hotels all over Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended for couples with a young child”
Reviews.Author: Sarita2
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first stop in Italy and I was really looking forward to it however it was marred with my choice of hotel. The only positive of this hotel is its affordable rate though the owner made us pay the charges in advance. They do not have triple rooms so if you have a child - they make you pay for a 4 bedded room. The room after paying so much extra did not have any view and opened into another dingy building. They did not provide us bath soaps in the toilet. To reach the hotel from the vaporetto station you have to cross a stair case and go down a narrow alley. It was raining heavily the day we left but we had to walk to the vaporetto station as the hotel manager said that the boats in the canal will not be able to reach the hotel. Terrible experience - will not repeat it..

Reviews.Title: “romantic canal view”
Reviews.Author: tumbleweeds02
Reviews.Content: two couples stayed for two nights , we got canal view rooms as per our e-mail request, large rooms & clean, allot of people watching, gondola watching from our rooms, some noise from the local supply boats, however if you close the wooden and glass windows it helps with the noise early in the morning. It was not an issue for us. We sat on the balcony and watched all the activities on the canal and on the side street. Breakfast was good and friendly staff. It is very close to both the Rialto and San Marco Plaza. It's family owned and the owner got up very early to assist with our early departure. The cafeteria next to the Rialto is very good and inexpensive. Pizza, ,goulash with mash potatoes, and mushroom spaghetti were very good. Farmers market across the rialto bridge has allot of good fruit etc for picnic fixings. Good vendors to bargain with for lace goods.

Reviews.Title: “A true, affordable Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: martiflat
Reviews.Content: This small one star hotel is a bit shabby but it more than makes up for that with lots of positives: -a great location (on a side canal very clost to Rialto Bridge and 10mins walk to St Marks) -very reasonable room rates -decent sized,clean rooms (no. 38) -canal view including singing gondolias but also the rubbish collection barge (at around 7am except Sunday) -reasonable breakfast -helpful reception. If you want value for money in Venice, don't mind a bit of noise from passing motor boats and are not looking for smart furnishings, then the Caneva delivers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable, but disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: rose_11r
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location although difficult to find the first time - make sure you have good directions or you will be searching for ages. Close to everything and good value in that sense. Rooms small but this is fairly standard and fine as long as you're planning to get out and about and not spend all your time inside. Located on a canal which is nice, although we found it noisy, particulalry from quite early in the morning as across the canal appeared to be some sort of depot or collection spot. Breakfast basic but adequate, but doesn't cater for anyone with dietary issues such as gluten intolerance. Showers tiny and not very clean. Hotel cleanliness generally OK but not that great either - I didn't think they changed the towels while we were there. Some problems from the time we arrived - we booked a room with a bathroom and were given one without. The owner said this was our problem and refused to entertain any alternative, despite us showing him our booking print out which clearly showed we had booked and paid for a room with a bathroom. The Manager/ Owner was then rude to us throughout our stay, verging on hostile at times. He seemed annoyed with any questions; at one point the telephone in the lobby did not work and he wouldn't help; and on in this vein. Generally unpleasant and unhelpful. The night manager was a nice enough fellow but extremely pushy with selling his own tours around Venice - hard to get a word in or get away from him once he started his spiel. Other staff didn't talk to the guests at all. In the end, we couldn't wait to leave. Good value for the location, but I wouldn't stay there again, given the poor service, average accommodation and overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “a delightful find in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: pbCanada
Reviews.Content: There is lots of positive and very little negative to say about this hotel. It's location is perfect -- only about a 5 minute walk away from either the Rialto Bridge or St. Mark's square. The hotel itself is located in a tiny quiet courtyard. All guest rooms are on the first floor -- so only one flight of stairs have to be climbed. Our 3-person room -- #42 -- was right beside the breakfast room and had a splendid narrow balcony overlooking a side canal. My mother would sit and watch the gondola's pass by below. Breakfast was quite good -- cornflakes and granola cereal, buns and croissants plus jam, butter or those little cheeses. Coffee, cappuccino, orange juice and water. AND canned peach-halves! The best part -- it's 'serve-yourself'! The few negatives involved the lack of hot water and the noise from outside. The water from faucets in our bathroom did not get very hot, not even after 5 minutes of letting the water run. So I had my shower in the a shower located down the hall. Here the water got VERY hot. Also each morning, except Sunday, a garbage scow comes to collect garbage from the area and is quite noisy for at least an hour or two. But the rest of the day you hear only the sound of people in gondola's below or the motors from water taxis passing by. I would stay here again and again. The advantages far outweigh the negatives. This hotel and its attentive staff helped make our stay in Venice an extremely enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Fair value”
Reviews.Author: LimPL
Reviews.Content: We read many wonderful reviews about this pension. Decided to book it for our stay in late Aug last year. The pension is located right in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Venice, and yet in a quiet corner for perfect privacy. Room was big and spartan. Even though it was during the late summer, it was still very hot. There was an air conditioner in the room, but we were told that we cannot switch it on and had to seek permission from the owner in order to do so. With the heat and mosquitoes, we were unable to sleep for the first 2 nights. As our room faces the canal, we were woken up daily at 5am from the motor boats, not even having serenades from beautiful gondoliers during the day can make up for the loss of sleep. Breakfast was adequate, not fantastic. On the third night, we decided to try the air con, and it worked! But with the location and price, it was worth it. Just don't request for a room near the canal and just try switching on the air conditioner, it might just works!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price”
Reviews.Author: PM-of-M
Reviews.Content: The Caneva is in a great, quiet location. It is only a couple of minutes away from Rialto bridge, and only 5 minutes to the main part of Venice. The room was pretty big, but had no air conditioning and only a dodgy fan, which was an issue in summer. However, all of this didn't seem to matter as our room backed onto the Canal, so we could watch the gondoliers go past, which was amazing. We also caught a water taxi from the back door of hotel which was great. Breakfast was pretty good, and the room was very well priced for Venice. The owner wasn't nearly as dodgy as everyone made him out to be, I would stay here again!! Oh, and we got lost trying to find this place!! Follow the signs to Rialto Bridge, and then turn left at the street next to the Disney store.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad as long as you know what to expect”
Reviews.Author: blork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Caneva in May 2006 for three nights. The room was quite large by European standards, but quite plain. There was, however, a big window overlooking the canal, which was wonderful. The floor in the bathroom felt like it had rotted through under the linoleum-like flooring, which was weird. The night clerk tried, as people have mentioned, to corner us and to give us his lecture/sales pitch, but we kept (politely) blowing him off. It kind of annoyed him, but we just kept smiling and in the end it was a bit of a joke. Breakfast was adequate. Coffee/tea, a few kinds of cereal, yogurt, and a few packaged croissants and melba toasts (along with jams, peanut butter, etc.) So far it doesn't sound so impressive. But consider the context: getting there was easy -- the walk from the vaporetto took only four or five minutes, and what magical minutes! The location is perfect for exploring that part of Venice (the busiest part), and the fact that the hotel is right on a canal makes it even more special. Plus, the price was quite reasonable for central Venice. However, if you want to be pampered, or if you expect all new furniture and perfect soundproofing, then this is not the place for you. And of course you might hit some bad luck with screwball reservation issues like others have described. But if you think there's no way you could afford to sleep in central Venice because you only have about 100 Euros a night for your budget, then this place will prove you wrong. But it is certainly not the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “the owner of the hotel is not honest”
Reviews.Author: stone-nanjing
Reviews.Content: I contacted the hotel by email, I browsed internet and found breakfast included and 3 days cancelling period, then I booked. After my booking, the owner said no breakfast and 7 days cancelling in his email message to answer my booking, I felt cheated and asked his permission for cancelling, but he gave no answer even after I sent two faxs and several email messages about this matter. How rude and dishonest the ower is! what he did is just for money without considering the guest.

Reviews.Title: “spotless amidst the crumbles”
Reviews.Author: farmer000
Reviews.Content: Our twin en suite was spotlessly clean and large. The floor did slope but that is Venice. The breakfast was adequate. The external fabric of the building would make a renovator salivate but inside all looked in good if somewhat patched condition. Our window did not shut properly so we heard all the gondoliers calling out at the corner and the garbage boat at 6.30 a.m.but it gave us a true Venetian experience. I asked about the much commented on (in Trip adviser) walk and the Monday concierge knew nothing of it. However this hotel is in a wonderful location and the directions to it from the Rialto bridge worked. This hotel is good value for money in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “incredible treatment at Hotel Caneva”
Reviews.Author: klmalx
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible experience at the front desk of this hotel! Arriving with a reservation for 1night the manager told us that he made the reservation for 2nights and nothing could change his mind not even my fax confirmation. We suggested him to pay more for 1night as confirmed but he even did not attend us anymore. As I am working in a travel agency I realized later that he simply overbooked the rooms but not even wanted to help us to find another room for 1night. I have never been treated like that in my whole life travelling for holidays and business in the last 30 years. We then had to find another hotel with all the luggage (going on a cruise later) and found a superb compensation in the Hotel Bartolomeo quiet close. A place we would recommend to everybody for the next trip!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, great location, and very friendly staff...especially Bruno who works at the front desk!! My mom and I are def. going to stay there again :-)

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great! I would stay here over and over again!”
Reviews.Author: Tren2414
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Venice and I was a little worried that this hotel would not be up to standards. After looking at the reviews on tripadvisor.com I decided what the heck - it sounds good enough. Plus the price was right! Upon arriving at the hotel, it was very easy to find with the directions the hotel provided. The location was simply amazing! It was 2 minutes away from the rigato bridge and 5 minutes walk to San Marco. It also had a internet point within 1 minute walking distance! The room was more then expected for the price we paid. We were in room 27. The room had high ceiling, very clean, tv and a canal view from our window! It was amazing seeing boats and gondolas past by. If it were any other hotel, you would pay an arm and a leg fora canal view! The hotel was also quiet for being so close to everything. We slept like a baby! The women and man who worked downstairs where helpful with all our questions and anything we needed during our stay! We had a room without a bath room but that wasnt a problem. The bathroom was right next door and suprisingly clean as can be. It you are looking for a good value, great experience, and a hotel that is just right - this is it. Its not a four seasons or Marriott but it has character and is also very charming! I am one of the pickest people you would ever meet and this place has left me with fond memories that I will keep with me forever. Thank you to the staff and my stay at Hotel Caneva! It is definitely a romantic city :)

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value close to main tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: WayneTim
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was small but clean, amazing canal view from the window. Hotel is well located in a quiet cul-de-sac near the Rialto Bridge. However, the locality is crowded with tourists during the day and early evening, so it if we were to return I would choose a hotel away from the tourist sites (eg The Lido). Breakfast was dreadful, so I would avoid. At 100 euros a night, it is probably good value. Front desk staff were friendly, but beware of the hard-sell for the Venice Walking Tour on offer.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat value/money in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Poncho_1980
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel in 2001 and frankly didn't expect very much since the amount paid was very little for venice standards and the hotel was rated as a 1 star. Surprisingly I got everything normally found in a good 3 star hotel. We got a clean, decent sized room facing a canal, with private en suite facilities (inlcuding walk in shower without typical floor flooding leaks), great buffett breakfast with nice view, and unbeatable location exactly between the Rialto bridge and San Marco. The only "problems" found were that it was a bit difficult to find (but then this is common for venice), and that once they didn't replace our soap, but as soon as I asked I got 3 :). So, I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone but I suggest to book early. I just returned from Venice this month and unfortunately this hotel was fully booked. I ended up in Locanda ai Santi Apostoli, which turned out to be a success but for about 3 times the price...

Reviews.Title: “Good For the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel before we went to Italy, simply by reading reviews. Easy to find, simply take the boat to Rialto bridge and follow the directions from the hotel. Simple, clean rooms, breakfast was not all that great if you got there late! So if you want to eat, get up early! Bruno, one of the guys at the desk, likes to push his tours on you but simply say no thanks and he is good to go! All in all, good value for Venice in August. We paid 100E a night for a double room.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Caneva
HotelInfo.Address: Castello 5515 | Ramo dietro la Fava, 30122 Venice, Italy
